docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 -- A major Federal study of the nation's health care costs, made public today, forecasts that medical expenses will rise 50 per cent in the first half of this decade to more than $100-billion.

headline.main: HEALTH COST RISE OF 50% PREDICTED; Federal Study Puts Total at a 'Staggering' $105-Billion in the Fiscal Year 1974 50% Rise in Health Care Costs Predicted for Fiscal Year 1974

docs.abstract: Soc Security Adm study of nation's health care, predicting that med expenses will rise 50% in 1st half of decade to more than $100-billion, predicts increased utilization of drugs
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 -- A major Federal study of the nation's health care costs, made public today, forecasts that medical expenses will rise 50 per cent in the first half of this decade to more than $100-billion.

byline.original: By RICHARD D. LYONSSpecial to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: CHANTILLY, France, July 31 -- France has the best, most scientifically drugged thoroughbreds in the world. But it's all perfectly legal.
docs.abstract: Article on French racing soc efforts to detect and prevent drugging
docs.snippet: CHANTILLY, France, July 31 -- France has the best, most scientifically drugged thoroughbreds in the world. But it's all perfectly legal.

byline.original: By JAMES BROWNSpecial to The New York Times
